subject: fix: use network-first caching for JS/CSS so hard reload gets latest code
body:
The service worker was using stale-while-revalidate for JS/CSS, which
returns cached content before checking the network. This meant hard
reload (Ctrl+Shift+R) still served stale app code from CacheStorage,
since CacheStorage is separate from the browser HTTP cache.

Changed to network-first: always fetch latest from network, only fall
back to cache when offline. Bumped cache version to v6 to clear stale
caches for existing users. Also fixed "banner" references to "button"
in docs and sw.js comments.
